intro: Tryphostemma gossweileri, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive tubular shape. The plant produces small, woody capsules that contain numerous seeds with tufts of hair for wind dispersal.
